name: Pad Thai
method: Soak the rice noodles in warm water for 10 minutes, then drain and set aside.
Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
Add the garlic and shrimp, and cook for 2-3 minutes until the shrimp are pink.
Push the shrimp to the side of the pan and crack the eggs into the center.
Scramble the eggs, then mix with the shrimp.
Add the rice noodles, fish sauce, brown sugar, and tamarind paste, and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until the noodles are cooked through.
Stir in the peanuts and green onions.
Serve with lime wedges.

name: Tom Yum Soup
method: Bring the chicken broth to a boil in a large pot.
Add the lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, fish sauce, lime juice, sugar, and chili paste.
Simmer for 5 minutes.
Add the mushrooms and shrimp, and cook for another 3-4 minutes until the shrimp are pink.
Stir in the cilantro leaves and serve hot.

name: Green Curry Chicken
way_of_making:
1. In a pot, heat green curry paste until fragrant.
2. Add coconut milk and bring to a simmer.
3. Add chicken and vegetables, and cook until chicken is done.
4. Serve with Thai basil and rice.

name: Massaman Curry
way_of_making:
1. In a pot, heat massaman curry paste until fragrant.
2. Add coconut milk and bring to a simmer.
3. Add beef, potatoes, onions, and cinnamon, and cook until beef is done.
4. Serve with peanuts and rice.

name: Papaya Salad
way_of_making:
1. Shred green papaya and carrots.
2. Add chopped tomatoes and peanuts.
3. Mix lime juice, fish sauce, palm sugar, and chili peppers to make dressing.
4. Toss salad with dressing and serve.

name: Red Curry Shrimp
way_of_making:
1. In a pot, heat red curry paste until fragrant.
2. Add coconut milk and bring to a simmer.
3. Add shrimp, pineapple, and bell peppers, and cook until shrimp is pink.
4. Serve with Thai basil and rice.

name: Tom Kha Gai
way_of_making:
1. Boil galangal, lemongrass, and kaffir lime leaves in water.
2. Add coconut milk and bring to a simmer.
3. Add chicken and mushrooms, and cook until chicken is done.

name: Tom Kha Gai
